com.busit

Interface Producer


  • public interface Producer
    This interface specifies that the connector can emit a new message out of the blue. 
     public class Clock extends Connector implements Producer
 {
      public IMessage produce(Interface out)
      {
           IMessage message = Factory.message();
           IContent data = Factory.content(0);
           data.put("data", new SimpleDateFormat(out.value).format(new Date()));
           message.content(data);
           return message;
      }

      public IMessage sample(Interface out)
      {
           return produce(out);
      }
 
      public boolean test() throws Exception
      {
                 return true;
      }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • produce

        IMessage produce(Interface out)
        Produce a message.
        Parameters:
        out - the target connector output
        Returns:
        the new message or null if nothing is produced

      • sample

        IMessage sample(Interface out)
        Produce a sample test message.
        Parameters:
        out - the target connector output
        Returns:
        the new message filled with sample data

      • test

        boolean test()
             throws Exception
        Tests if the connector works. You should build unit tests for your connector in this method and check for external resources or anything you rely on. This method is intented to test if your connector works as is, not as part of a scenario. Thus the runtime instance of your implementation is to be considered as an anonymous instance : the config, inputs and outputs will be defaults as you declared them, and not customized by the user. Thus if you rely on externally populated or specific configuration process values or else, those will not be available.
        Returns:
        true if the connector should work properly, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception - Any exception is allowed to be thrown and is considered as a failure equivalent to returning false. However, throwing an exception allows to mention a specific cause that will eventually help troubleshooting.
